title: [1508521049] 3 Reasons Why You Will Inevitably Ride An E-bike | The GCN Show Ep. 243
description:
It's inevitable. You will ride an e-bike, and in this week's GCN Show we'll tell you why. And maybe why you won't.

Subscribe to GCN: http://gcn.eu/SubscribeToGCN
Register your interest in the GCN Club: http://gcn.eu/nh
Get exclusive GCN gear in the GCN shop! http://gcn.eu/ng

E-bikes aside, we've got plenty of hot news for you from right across the cycling world on The GCN Show. 

Racing updates are coming in thick and fast this week, with the very latest from the Tour of Spain, la Vuelta, where Chris Froome is still sitting pretty in red. It was a Dutch dominated Boels Rental Ladies Tour in Holland, with Annemiek van Vleuten taking top step, leading from the start with an impressive TT prologue. In the current Tour of Britain we saw Caleb Ewan take the first stage, whilst the second stage sprint was a little more controversial... 

On the less conventional racing front, we see multi-storey car park racing in New Zealand announced and the third round of the Red Hook Crit in Barcelona.

This week's #WattageBazooka goes to the Superman himself, Miguel Angel Lopez of Astana, and our viewer entry from India on these 23% switchbacks. Ouch! 

Competition Time! For your chance to win one of the ControlTech bars click here

asset.title: 3 Reasons Why You Will Inevitably Ride An E-bike | The GCN Show Ep. 243
asset.description:
It's inevitable. You will ride an e-bike, and in this week's GCN Show we'll tell you why. And maybe why you won't.

Subscribe to GCN: http://gcn.eu/SubscribeToGCN
Register your interest in the GCN Club: http://gcn.eu/nh
Get exclusive GCN gear in the GCN shop! http://gcn.eu/ng

E-bikes aside, we've got plenty of hot news for you from right across the cycling world on The GCN Show. 

Racing updates are coming in thick and fast this week, with the very latest from the Tour of Spain, la Vuelta, where Chris Froome is still sitting pretty in red. It was a Dutch dominated Boels Rental Ladies Tour in Holland, with Annemiek van Vleuten taking top step, leading from the start with an impressive TT prologue. In the current Tour of Britain we saw Caleb Ewan take the first stage, whilst the second stage sprint was a little more controversial... 

On the less conventional racing front, we see multi-storey car park racing in New Zealand announced and the third round of the Red Hook Crit in Barcelona.

This week's #WattageBazooka goes to the Superman himself, Miguel Angel Lopez of Astana, and our viewer entry from India on these 23% switchbacks. Ouch! 

Competition Time! For your chance to win one of the ControlTech bars click here 👉 http://gcn.eu/WINCT

You can also enter the Lightweight Wheels Competition here 🇩🇪 http://gcn.eu/WINLightweight

And the Fi'zi:k saddle and shoes Competition here 🇮🇹 http://gcn.eu/fizik2018

We've got Hack/Bodge of the Week, Extreme Corner, and an update from the Round The World hero Mark Beaumont himself. Don't forget to send him your messages of support as he enters the last quarter of his epic challenge. 

Our Caption Competition winner this week is Patrick Sheard. Don't forget to send in your captions for Russ Downing, and could someone please explain it to Dan...?!

Nicole Reist impressively won the Race Around Ireland, covering 2214km in just 112 hours. Yes, that's over 19kph average... 

Keep tuned on the channel this week with more shiny new tech from Eurobike to share with you, the long awaited Zwift for beginners, Contador's career ending Trek, Simon teaches us how to build a wheel and we even unbox the new Wattbike. That'll be a big box. 

If you'd like to contribute captions and video info in your language, here's the link 👍 http://gcn.eu/nf

Watch more on GCN...
Indoor training tech from Eurobike 2017 📹  http://gcn.eu/IndoorTrainers
How (not) to build a power meter - factory tour 📹  http://gcn.eu/BuildPower

Photos: © Bettiniphoto / http://www.bettiniphoto.net/ & ©Tim De Waele / http://www.tdwsport.com

About GCN:

The Global Cycling Network puts you in the centre of the action: from the iconic climbs of Alpe D’Huez and Mont Ventoux to the cobbles of Flanders, everywhere there is road or pavé, world-class racing and pro riders, we will be there bringing you action, analysis and unparalleled access every week, every month, and every year. We show you how to be a better cyclist with our bike maintenance videos, tips for improving your cycling, cycling top tens, and not forgetting the weekly GCN Show. Join us on YouTube’s biggest and best cycling channel to get closer to the action and improve your riding!

Welcome to the Global Cycling Network | Inside cycling
